message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting and blacklisting malicious agents in a system, which is a common problem in computer security (cs.CR). The authors propose an algorithm for making near-optimal decisions, which involves making decisions based on the expected profit of the system, which is a common approach in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The algorithm also involves making decisions based on the probability of an agent being malicious, which can be modeled using probabilistic data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The problem of maximizing expected profit can also be formulated as a game-theoretic problem (cs.GT). Finally, the authors use theoretical analysis and experimental evaluation to validate their approach, which involves statistical and machine learning techniques (cs.LG).
